intro: Pimpinella saxifraga var. pubescens, commonly known as the pubescent cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that appear in umbels. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in open habitats such as cliffs or slopes. The variety pubescens is distinguished by its hairy or pubescent stems and leaves, giving it a distinctive appearance compared to other varieties of Pimpinella saxifraga.
